feat (Cart class) add Cart class domain.model to project ecommerce-api
feat (User class) add User class domain.model to project ecommerce-api
feat (Role class) add Role class domain.model to project ecommerce-api

feat (Repository interface) add CartRepository domain.repository to project ecommerce-api

feat (Service class) add ProductController adapter.controller to project ecommerce-api
feat (Service class) add ProductJpaRepository adapter.persistence to project ecommerce-api
feat (Service class) add SecurityConfig adapter.security to project ecommerce-api
feat (Service class) add UserService domain.service to project ecommerce-api

docs: update README with

Remove all project files and internal configurations.
Deleted source files, configuration files, and dependencies across multiple projects. This effectively cleans up the project structure and resets all progress for the listed directories.

Remove project files and configurations; add concurrency example
Deleted various project files, configuration settings, and dependencies, effectively resetting the repository state. Also added a new `StructuredConcurrencyExample.java` to demonstrate structured concurrency in Java.
feat(day One) part 01 - Criar um servidor HTTP com virtual threads para processar 10.000 requisições simultâneas, usando java.net.http
feat(day One) final project Day 01
feat(day Two) final project Day 02

Add RetryExample and day 03 configuration files
Introduced a `RetryExample` class demonstrating a retry mechanism with CompletableFuture. Configurations and annotations for day 03 were added, including module settings and a reference to resilience design patterns for further reading.

Add CircuitBreakerExample and update day 03 configs
Introduced a `CircuitBreakerExample` class utilizing Resilience4j to demonstrate circuit breaker functionality. Updated day 03 module configuration with relevant Resilience4j dependencies and project annotations. Enhanced development setup for improved fault tolerance exploration.

Add CircuitBreaker and Retry examples using Resilience4j
Introduced `CircuitBreakerRetry` and `RetryExampleTwo` classes to demonstrate fault tolerance with circuit breaker and retry mechanisms. Updated day 03 configurations to include Resilience4j dependencies for practical resilience pattern applications. Enhanced project for improved handling of transient failures.

Add RetryExampleThree to demonstrate retry mechanism
Introduced `RetryExampleThree` class utilizing Resilience4j to implement a retry mechanism with custom configurations. This enhances fault tolerance handling by showcasing automated retries for transient failures. Associated project files and settings were also updated to reflect these changes.

Add CircuitBreakerExampleTwo to demonstrate fault tolerance
Introduced `CircuitBreakerExampleTwo` class using Resilience4j to showcase circuit breaker and retry mechanisms with custom configurations. This example enhances understanding of handling transient failures through automated retries and circuit breaking. Associated project files were updated for consistency.
feat(final project) final project final day 03

feat: add ScopedValue example and User record
Introduced `ScopeValueExampleOne` class to demonstrate the use of scoped values in Java, providing a practical example with the `User` record. Updated project files to include new implementations for day 04.

feat: add VirtualThread examples for day 04
Introduced `VirtualThreadExampleOne` and `VirtualThreadExampleTwo` to demonstrate the usage of virtual threads in Java. These examples illustrate creating and managing virtual threads for concurrency. Updated workspace and project configurations accordingly.
feat(project day 04) finish project day 04, use ScopedValue and VirtualThread

Add CrawlerExampleOne to scrape webpage content
Introduced `CrawlerExampleOne` in `dia-05` to demonstrate basic web scraping using Jsoup. Updated project configuration and replaced references to previous examples with the new class. This finalizes enhancements for day 05.

Add ApiCrawler to perform API data fetching
Introduced `ApiCrawler` class in `dia-05` to fetch data from APIs using `HttpURLConnection`. Updated project configurations to include new references and replaced outdated components. This sets up the foundation for API interaction examples.

Add HTTP client examples for API interaction and web crawling
Introduced `HttpClientAsyncExample`, `HttpClientEx`, and `ProjectCrawlerWeb` in `dia-05` to demonstrate asynchronous and synchronous HTTP client usage, as well as basic web crawling. Updated project configuration files accordingly to include the new classes.
feat (final project) final project day 05 crawler web with Virtual Thread

feat: add ThreadSleeperTest for race condition testing
Introduced `ThreadSleeperTest` in `dia-06` to demonstrate race condition scenarios using atomic operations. Updated project configurations to include the new test class.

feat: add ThreadCountLacthTest for concurrency testing
Introduced `ThreadCountLacthTest` in `dia-06` to demonstrate the usage of `CountDownLatch` for synchronizing threads. Updated project configurations to include the new test class.

feat: add ThreadPerformanceJMH for concurrent performance benchmarking
Introduced `ThreadPerformanceJMH` in `dia-06` to benchmark concurrent performance using JMH. Updated project configurations and removed outdated test class references.

feat: add ThreadStressTest for concurrency stress testing
Introduced `ThreadStressTest` in `dia-06` to simulate high-load scenarios and validate thread safety using atomic operations. Updated project configurations to include the new test class.
feat(day 05) project day 05 complete
feat(day 07) add concurrency queue examples and update project configurations
feat(day 07) add Task class and LinkedListQueueExample for concurrency demonstrations
feat(day 07) add ConcurrentQueueExample for concurrency demonstrations
feat(day 07) add LinkedBlockingQueueExample for concurrency demonstrations

feat(day 07) add additional queue examples for concurrency demonstrations
Added `SynchronousQueueExample`, `PriorityQueueExample`, `ArrayBlockingQueueExample`, and `PriorityBlockingQueueExample` to demonstrate various queue implementations for concurrent programming in Java. Updated project configurations accordingly.

chore: update IntelliJ IDE configuration files
Adjusted `.idea` project configuration files to reflect changes in VCS mappings, module loading, and run configurations. Cleared outdated entries and synchronized project settings.
feat(day 07) final project add ProjectQueueSystem with prioritized task execution

feat(day 08) initialize Spring Boot project API with JPA integration
Added a new `demo-api` project under `semana-02/dia-08` utilizing Spring Boot. Included JPA integration, H2 database, and basic configurations. Added `Usuario` entity, `UsuarioRepository` interface, and corresponding test class.

feat(day 08) add `UsuarioController` with CRUD endpoints
Introduced `UsuarioController` to manage user entities. Added CRUD endpoints for creating, listing, updating, and deleting users with appropriate validations and exception handling.

feat(day 08) enhance `UsuarioController` with improved validation and additional endpoints
Refined validation logic using record patterns, added `buscarPorId` and `atualizar` endpoints, and improved exception handling for better error messaging.
feat(day 08) finally project day 08 "Criar uma API REST com Spring Boot 3.3 para gerenciamento de usuários, usando record patterns (JEP 440)."
delete(file) delete file dia-01
